langmuir_probes.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

langmuir_probes.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

langmuir_probes.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

langmuir_probes.embedded.documentation: Set of embedded (in a plasma facing component) probes or probe pins

langmuir_probes.embedded[:].b_field_angl.documentation: Incident angle of the magnetic field with respect to PFC surface
Index in the error_description list for "data"

Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

langmuir_probes.embedded[:].distance_sep.documentation: Distance of the measurement position to the separatrix (positive means the measurement is outside of the separatrix)

langmuir_probes.embedded[:].time.documentation: Timebase for the dynamic nodes of this probe located at this level of the IDS structure

langmuir_probes.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

langmuir_probes.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

langmuir_probes.ids_properties.creation_.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

langmuir_probes.ids_properties.homogeneo.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

langmuir_probes.ids_properties.occurrenc.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

langmuir_probes.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

langmuir_probes.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

langmuir_probes.ids_properties.version_p.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

langmuir_probes.reciprocating.documentation: Set of reciprocating probes or probe pins

langmuir_probes.reciprocating[:].plunge.documentation: Set of plunges of this probe during the pulse, each plunge being recorded as a time slice from the Access Layer point of view. The time child node corresponds to the time of maximum penetration of the probe during a given plunge. The dynamics of physicas quantities within the plunge are described via the time_within_plunge vector.
